body:
**Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST?**:

/kind bug

**What happened**: `default-http-backend` service selects `l7-lb-controller` pod as backend.
Create a k8s cluster on GCE using `go run hack/e2e.go -up` command.
Output from couple kubectl commands:
```
$ kubectl get svc default-http-backend --namespace=kube-system
NAME                   CLUSTER-IP     EXTERNAL-IP   PORT(S)             AGE
default-http-backend   10.0.212.129   <nodes>       80:30864/TCP        6h

$ kubectl get ep default-http-backend --namespace=kube-system
NAME                   ENDPOINTS                         AGE
default-http-backend   10.100.2.3:8080,10.128.0.2:8080   6h

$ kubectl get pods --namespace=kube-system -o wide
NAME                                              READY     STATUS    RESTARTS   AGE       IP           NODE
...
l7-default-backend-2053678608-t4wwq               1/1       Running   0          5h        10.100.2.3   e2e-test-zihongz-minion-group-zdq4
l7-lb-controller-v0.9.5-e2e-test-zihongz-master   1/1       Running   0          5h        10.128.0.2   e2e-test-zihongz-master
...
```

And apparently l7-lb-controller doesn't serve the default 404 page:
```
# curl l7-default-backend pod
$ curl 10.100.2.3:8080
default backend

# curl l7-lb-controller pod
$ curl 10.128.0.2:8080
curl: (7) couldn't connect to host

# intermittent failures when curling service VIP
$ curl 10.0.212.129:80
curl: (7) couldn't connect to host
$ curl 10.0.212.129:80
default backend - 404
$ curl 10.0.212.129:80
default backend - 404
$ curl 10.0.212.129:80
default backend - 404
$ curl 10.0.212.129:80
curl: (7) couldn't connect to host
$ curl 10.0.212.129:80
curl: (7) couldn't connect to host
$ curl 10.0.212.129:80
default backend - 404
```

**What you expected to happen**:

`l7-lb-controller` shouldn't be selected by `default-http-backend` service.

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**: See "What happened" section.


**Anything else we need to know?**:
cc @freehan who found it :)
/sig network

**Environment**:
- Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`):
```
Client Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"7", GitVersion:"v1.7.0", GitCommit:"d3ada0119e776222f11ec7945e6d860061339aad", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2017-06-29T23:15:59Z", GoVersion:"go1.8.3", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
Server Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"8+", GitVersion:"v1.8.0-alpha.2.299+290a0edaf35a65-dirty", GitCommit:"290a0edaf35a65bf5faf18c8bc704dad189ad946", GitTreeState:"dirty", BuildDate:"2017-07-18T00:22:43Z", GoVersion:"go1.8.3", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
```
- Cloud provider or hardware configuration**: GCE
- OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release):
- Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`):
- Install tools:
- Others:

labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.
labels.name: kind/bug

labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to SIG Network.
labels.name: sig/network

title: `default-http-backend` service shouldn't select `l7-lb-controller` pod as backend
